answer.title: Bug 108822More better logic is expected to process disk sorting when there is border value for row value
answer.OB: when sort on disk, if sort on 40000 rows data, and set the program process thedata less than 40000.DtE do following operation1.
answer.EB: The sort should be performed on the full 40000 rows of data, not on the 40000-1 rows.
answer.SR: when sort on disk, if sort on 40000 rows data, and set the program process thedata less than 40000.DtE do following operation1. Save the file as temp file2. Call the file to memory3. Sort on the data4. save the file to temp file5.

answer.title: Bug 109350
answer.description: output parameter should display in data set dialog.
answer.OB: While in query result page, there isno data returnedactual result:output parameter should display in edit data set dialog.
answer.EB: Bug 109350output parameter should display in data set dialog.
answer.SR: When call the stored procedure from Oracle database, the query result has beenstored in output parameter as an object. While in query result page, there isno data returnedactual result:output parameter should display in edit data set dialog.

answer.title: Bug 114905The default value set in list box of report parameter lost after modify the default value.
answer.description: Description:The default value set in list box of report parameter lost after modify thedefault value.Steps to reproduce:1.
answer.OB: Bug 114905The default value set in list box of report parameter lost after modify the default value.
answer.EB: Change the Display type to Combo BoxExpected result:"aaa" is the default value.After step 5, OK button should be gray.Actual result:No default value was set.After step 5, OK button still can be used.
answer.SR:
1. Change the Display type to Combo Box
2. Set default value to "aaa"
3. Set the display value to "bbb"
4. Modify the default value to "ccc"
5. Click OK button
Expected result:"aaa" is the default value.After step 5, OK button should be gray.Actual result:No default value was set.After step 5, OK button still can be used.

answer.title: Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask
answer.description: Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask If so, parse it and form a range and output them one after another, with a page splitter in between just like the runAndRenderTask. There can only be one page in case a page number is set.
answer.OB: Support page range in render task.For PDF format, simply log a message saying range is not supported if a range is specified, and still output whole report.For HTML format, support page range in the form of "1,2,510" + "All". Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned.
answer.EB: The code should check if there is range set. Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned. If neither is set, we default to all pages, instead of the current behavior of giving an error message.
answer.SR: Support page range in render task.For PDF format, simply log a message saying range is not supported if a range is specified, and still output whole report.For HTML format, support page range in the form of "1,2,510" + "All". Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned.

answer.OB: I am testing BIRT 2.0 RC2 and am running into a problem where Preview (from the toolbar) in the Web Viewer will only show the first report I opened in a session.

answer.SR: To reproduce the problem:1. Start BIRT 2.0 RC2, create a project and import the attached two designs into the project.2. Open Product Catalog and then click on the Preview button on the toolbar to see the report. Once you have viewed the report, close the viewer.3.

answer.title: Bug 124570Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session

Open Sales Invoice and click on the Preview button again. Actual Result: You see the Product Catalog report again. Expected Result: You should see the Sales Invoice report.

answer.SR: I am testing BIRT 2.0 RC2 and am running into a problem where Preview (from the toolbar) in the Web Viewer will only show the first report I opened in a session. Open Sales Invoice and click on the Preview button again. Actual Result: You see the Product Catalog report again. Expected Result: You should see the Sales Invoice report.

answer.title: Bug 121170get column label from meta data object should return some user recognizable strings
answer.description: Calling IMetaData.getColumnLabel() before/after data extraction have different results.
answer.OB: I have a data extraction job with a meta data object, when I call IMetaData.getColumnLabel() before data extraction, it returns some user recognizable string, but after data extraction, it returns the same string as IMetaData.getColumnLabel().
answer.EB: I expect IMetaData.getColumnLabel() to return some user recognizable string before data extraction, and the same string after data extraction.
answer.SR: Calling IMetaData.getColumnLabel() before/after data extraction have different results.

answer.title: Bug 124620Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted
answer.description: Bug 124620Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted
answer.OB: Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened. But if those operations happened in dataset, the icon of dataset in the report will be invalid.
answer.EB: The icon of dataset in the report should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted.
answer.SR: 1. Open the report design file. 2. Delete the parameter in library. 3. Reopen the report design file. 4. Check the icon of parameter in the report design file. 5. Check the icon of dataset in the report. 6. If the icon of parameter is invalid, the icon of dataset in the report should be invalid.

answer.OB: Insert a report scalar parameter.2.Create a report, use the above library. In the library explorer, pull the parameter to the data explorer view of report.3.Open the library file, delete the parameter. Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened.
answer.EB: The parameter icon should be invalid when the parameter is deleted in the library.
answer.SR: Insert a report scalar parameter.2.Create a report, use the above library. In the library explorer, pull the parameter to the data explorer view of report.3.Open the library file, delete the parameter. Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter should be invalid.

answer.title: Bug 7752Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails.
answer.description: Steps to reproduce:1.
answer.OB: The system does not work.
answer.EB: The system should be able to export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file.

answer.title: Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type
answer.description: Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon.
answer.OB: 1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown.
answer.EB: The file is for all intents and purposes nowa generic file, as opening it will provethe file is opened as text.Expected Behaviour:The file should be saved with the same extension as the original unlessexplicitly changed.
answer.SR: 1) Open an existing java file2) Modify it (I moved an existing class)3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save IconA dialog will come up.4) Browse for a valid container location5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.6) Click Ok.Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, butwith no file extension shown.

answer.EB: The file extension should be automatically detected and added to the file name.

answer.title: Bug 20249[Help] Change editor/view/perspective F1 help

answer.title: Bug 18915[Preferences] switching between erroneous preferences pages should generate error, not warning.
answer.OB: If I enter invalid data on any preference pages (and it red flags me on the UI), if I try to select a another page without fixing the problem, I get the following warning dialog: "warningThe currently displayed page contains invalid values"This should be an "error" dialog considering one is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
answer.EB: If I enter invalid data on any preference pages (and it red flags me on the UI), if I try to select a another page without fixing the problem, I get the following warning dialog: "warningThe currently displayed page contains invalid values"This should be an "error" dialog considering one is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
answer.SR: If I enter invalid data on any preference pages (and it red flags me on the UI), if I try to select a another page without fixing the problem, I get the following warning dialog: "warningThe currently displayed page contains invalid values"This should be an "error" dialog considering one is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.

answer.title: Bug 24779[Perspectives] Reference to invalid views are not removed
answer.description: Bug 24779[Perspectives] Reference to invalid views are not removed It already tried, and it can't.8.
answer.OB: Open eclipse, open a view which belong to a plugin you can easily add and remove (I used the EditorList plugin).
answer.EB: Open an other perspective (the 'Java' perspective for example). You have now two opened perspective. Close eclipse. 4. Remove/Move the plugin 5. Switch to the perspective which contains the view which no longer exists. Same 'Unable to restore perspective ...' error message. Close and restart eclipse. No more error messages.
answer.SR: Open eclipse, open a view which belong to a plugin you can easily add and remove (I used the EditorList plugin). Open an other perspective (the 'Java' perspective for example). You have now two opened perspective. Close eclipse. 4. Remove/Move the plugin 5. Switch to the perspective which contains the view which no longer exists. Same 'Unable to restore perspective ...' error message. Close and restart eclipse. No more error messages.

answer.title: Bug 10654Allow all jars in a folder to be added to build path
answer.description: Bug 10654Allow all jars in a folder to be added to build path
answer.OB: When adding jar files to the build path using classpath variables, you have tospecify each jar file separately, even if there are several in the samedirectory.
answer.EB: It would be useful if you could use a classpath variable to point tothe whole directory, so that all jar files in that directory are added to thebuild path.This would be analogous to the installed extensions feature of the java launcher you can specify the system property java.ext.dirs to point to a list ofdirectories containing jar files to be automatically added to the classpath.This feature suggested itself to me after using a class contained in theWebSphere Test Environment plugin (in WSAD4.0).
answer.SR: In order to add all jar files in a folder to the build path, you have to specify the path to the folder, e.g. C:	emp	est\lib, and use the classpath variable WSAD_CLASSPATH_VARIABLE to point to this folder. This classpath variable will be added to the classpath automatically when you select the classpath option in the build path editor. This way, all jar files in the folder will be added to the classpath.

answer.SR: In a new workspace, press the "New Class" button in the Java perspective.2.

answer.title: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.description: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.OB: Build 20020416Right now, when one change the attached source of a jar, aFREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta is fired, which is obviously wrong.As a consequence, the UI reacts by closing the class file editors opened onthis jar, which is right for a FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta.However I tried to fix the delta to be a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED)delta, but the UI would not react.
answer.EB: In this case, I think it should refresh theclass file editor to get the new source.For now, I will fire a (FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH | FSOURCEDETACHED |FSOURCEATTACHED) delta, and I will remove the FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATHwhenthis bug is fixed.
answer.SR: In this case, I think it should refresh theclass file editor to get the new source.For now, I will fire a (FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH | FSOURCEDETACHED |FSOURCEATTACHED) delta, and I will remove the FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATHwhenthis bug is fixed.

answer.title: Bug 14943Code Assist does not respect platform line ends
answer.description: Bug 14943Code Assist does not respect platform line ends
answer.OB: Used code assist to create a for loop with temporary variable.The resulting code has LF as linefeeds on a windows machine.
answer.EB: The code assist should respect the platform line ends.
answer.SR: I performed the following scenario:1. Created a new class2. Added a method.3. Defined a local variable for an array4.

answer.OB: In this case, I think it should refresh theclass file editor to get the new source.For now, I will fire a (FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH | FSOURCEDETACHED |FSOURCEATTACHED) delta, and I will remove the FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATHwhenthis bug is fixed.
answer.EB: In this case, I think it should refresh theclass file editor to get the new source.For now, I will fire a (FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH | FSOURCEDETACHED |FSOURCEATTACHED) delta, and I will remove the FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATHwhenthis bug is fixed.
answer.SR: Build 20020416Right now, when one change the attached source of a jar, aFREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta is fired, which is obviously wrong.As a consequence, the UI reacts by closing the class file editors opened onthis jar, which is right for a FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta.However I tried to fix the delta to be a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED)delta, but the UI would not react.

answer.title: Bug 10403
answer.description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects & pointing the output folder at a bindirectory which contains more than just .class files which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
answer.OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, weshould confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt.Some users are creating projects & pointing the output folder at a bindirectory which contains more than just .class files which can be rebuilt fromthe available .java files.
answer.EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects & pointing the output folder at a bindirectory which contains more than just .class files which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
answer.SR: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects & pointing the output folder at a bindirectory which contains more than just .class files which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.

answer.EB: only the bottom edge of the outermost frames need to be repainted.
answer.SR: resize the window intheverticaldirectiononly notice that all tabs in the TabFolder and all Frames flash.

answer.title: Bug 19089No popup menu java editor ruler (Photon)
answer.description: Bug 19089No popup menu java editor ruler (Photon)
answer.OB: 1) Open a java editor2) Right click on the left vertical rulerThis should popup a menu to add breakpoints/marks,etc, butit does not.

answer.title: Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search
answer.description: Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search
answer.OB: Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search
answer.EB: A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly.
answer.SR: OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly.

answer.title: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.description: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.OB: I20030827Out of the box Ctrl+Backspace should delete the previous word.
answer.EB: Somehow the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word.If I try to reassing the key via key pref page it displays Ctrl+Del when I pressCtrl+Backspace.I have a Swiss German Keyboard using Swiss German Locale.
answer.SR: Somehow the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word.If I try to reassing the key via key pref page it displays Ctrl+Del when I pressCtrl+Backspace.I have a Swiss German Keyboard using Swiss German Locale.

answer.title: Bug 17825ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI
answer.description: Bug 17825ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI Somehow I don't think it's supposed todo that.
answer.OB: Then clicking on other buttons also makes the bell sound.
answer.EB: The bell should not sound when I choose SWT.MULTI.
answer.SR: Please click on the other buttons in the control to reproduce the issue.

answer.OB: Bug 23935Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus When you click anywhere in the tree the tree gets focus. On Linux the text never loses focus when you click on the tree. The text widget is a child of the tree.This causes platform UI bug 2470.
answer.EB: Bug 23935Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus The text widget should lose focus when you click on the tree.
answer.SR: Bug 23935Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus Click on the tree.

answer.title: Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first
answer.OB: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows.
answer.EB: The second window should not come to the front.
answer.SR: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows.

answer.title: Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
answer.description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
answer.OB: The problem is that the service is not stopping.
answer.EB: If that is the case, it would be better to use wait(10000) instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await(), so that it could be woken by a notifyAll() call, or use interrupt() call to wake it up (if we know the thread).
answer.SR: Install Tomcat as a service on Windows2. Start the service, and then stop the service.4. Shut down server through OS signal. E.g., to call Catalina.stop().

answer.title: Bug 49536
answer.description: Ali Tokmen
answer.OB: HelloI've just downloaded http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zipIf I start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps on it and access a URL, it returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content, instead of an HTTP error 404.CheersS.
